result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah D Hoffman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jeremiah D Hoffman
Current: N7162 Amundson Raod, Iola, WI 54945 United States  (Effective: 09-08-2014)
Prior: 217 Main St N, Amherst, WI 54406

Defendant Jeremiah D Hoffman in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF87, 13CF171, 13CT152, 13TR1928, 13TR1929, 13TR1930, 13TR1931

Atty Cousins indicates there will be a prelim waiver and arraignment in 14CF87.  That matter will be dismissed and read-in with the underlying OWI charge. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated. Makes additional statements. 

14CF87 only PRELIMINARY WAIVER / ARRAIGNMENT AT THIS TIME: 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.

**COURT NOW PROCEEDS TO PLEA HEARING PORTION ON ALL FILES**

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF171 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
13CT152 - NO CONTEST
13TR1928 - NO CONTEST
13TR1929 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
  

Blood Test Results .195
Defendant agrees this will result in his 5th conviction for OWI. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of the following: 
13CF171 Count 1 - OWI 5th offense 346.63(1)(a).  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CT152 - OAR 1st offense343.44(1)(b).  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 
13TR1928 - Open Intoxicants in Motor Vehicle
13TR1929 - Seatbelt Violation

13CF171 Count 2 - Dismissed.
14CF87 Dismissed and Read-in.
13TR1930 Dismissed and Read-in. 
13TR1931 Dismissed and Read-in. 

Court will order a PSI. 
Bond is ordered continued.
Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jeremiah D Hoffman in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. David Raymond Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Dalkert states there is a plea on the underlying charges.  Willing to waive the time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Comply with terms of bond in 13CF171 including  do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cass Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court advises defendant of right to remain silent. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Atty Cousins recommends a small cash bond with conditions.
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant makes statements to the Court. Defendant is not currently working.  Requests a signature bond. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  03-10-14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
